sub_title: Passionate to provide new insights while developing people and teams through personal and interpersonal interaction.

profile_positions.description: KidsCare Kenya (https://kidscare.or.ke) believes that every child has the right to a build on their future and develop the talents they have been born with. Therefore, together with our specialized partners, and in line with government policies we are dedicated to ensure that this basic right is achieved. Our HomeCare programs support and coaches families with orphans, abused children, teenage mothers and children with special abilities be it mental or physical. Our service centre is located in Mshiu, LungaLunga Sub-County. The service center is a unique facility in its area and enables us to offer a wide range of services to the neighborhood, a unique concept in the Sub-County. Earnings of the facility are used for our child supporting programs.
profile_positions.title: Social Psychological and Child Safety Advisor KidsCare Kenya

profile_positions.description:
Passionate about coaching people, teams and businesses towards enhanced fulfilment and ongoing sustainable growth through GeckoView’s holistic coaching approach. We leverage a broad spectrum of international experience ranging from personal balance, psychology to competence and skills towards personal, team, leadership and business excellence. 
As co-founder Brigitte leads the GeckoView Personal and Team Development branches.
profile_positions.title: Managing Director Personal and Team Development

profile_positions.description: Volunteering to actively support the HOPE Foundation charity organisation.  HOPE Foundation helps traumatised and handicapped children in refugees’ camps to build a more meaningful life for themselves. Please check out the Hope Foundation Linked-In company page as well as the website to experience how refugees’ quality and outlook of life is enhanced through initiatives involving culture and the arts.
profile_positions.title: Member of the Board

profile_positions.description: Reiki practitioner, trainer and personal coach

profile_positions.description: Accountable for all operational aspects of the Gladstone Women’s Health Centre, providing support, training, advice and professional counselling for matters of Women’s Health, Sexual Assault and Domestic Violence. Lead a team of counsellors, domestic violence specialist and admin staff and reported to the Board as well as the Queensland State funding departments. Maintained compliance to the accredited HSQF business systems and actively interfaced with associated departments including, sister support organisations in region and state, mental health, hospitals, police, correctional services and of course the large support base of local individual and business sponsors and volunteers. Managed all media coverage through frequent radio and TV sessions as well as local newspapers. Developed and implemented the first domestic violence prevention program in the region to coach men towards equal relationships.
profile_positions.title: Director

profile_positions.description:
The project studied the effect of applicant expectations and perceptions of organisations during and after recruitment and selection processes. The study provides researchers and organisations with specific guidance to enhance applicant’s experience and thus win the ‘war for talent’. 
The study resulted in my PhD, after successfully acquiring data from experiments and field studies with real life applicants, applying project management skills (planning, resourcing, budgeting, stakeholder management) to deliver project targets including publishing in international journals, presenting findings and conclusions at conferences and linking research to personal experience with industrial application processes.
profile_positions.title: PhD Project

profile_positions.description:
Training and business development at Shell South Africa; Trained personal communication skills and influencing others. Developed and implemented a project to measure “Employeeship” or employee contentment of all maintenance staff (100) to identify differences between employees of different South African races and age groups. The results were used for post-apartheid business optimisation. 
Life Coach to a considerable number of individuals in personal effectiveness (incl. study, work, relationships) and resulting in enhanced self-esteem and perseverance

profile_positions.company: BGO, Netherlands registered Brigitte Geenen Organisational Advice
profile_positions.description:
Adviser/trainer at Shell Netherlands: Identified and optimised a tool to assess and improve organisational culture. Coordinated workshops to change the organisational culture in the framework of the restructuring of the Shell International Tankers Company
Developed and managed major project to adapt university trained foreign refugees to be accountants in Holland. This project was funded by Dutch government. Recruited 300 candidates (Bachelors and up) and selected 50 for further intensive training. Developed a dedicated 6 months training programs to adapt people to the Western business culture and enhance relevant business skills such as negotiating, personal attitude, communication, presentations and influencing others. Counselled, coordinated and trained all 50 candidates to complete the courses. Through personal coaching and direct lobbying in the accounting business, ensured that all 50 trainees got practical training at Dutch accountants firms, mostly leading to permanent jobs.
profile_positions.title: Director BGO
